issue.title: [CF 86] Internal Cooldown Tracking
issue.body:
What is the enhancement in mind? How should it look and feel?
This should feel similar to NeedToKnow's internal cooldown, you can choose the name of the buff/debuff which triggers the ICD, and the user enters the ICD.

Examples:
-You gain trinket proc buff named "X", your TMW icon starts counting down from 45 seconds.
-You gain debuff Cauterize, your TMW icon starts counting down from 1 minute.
-Your target gains (your) debuff Improved Hamstring, your TMW icon starts counting down from 30 seconds.

Please provide any additional information below.
Personally I much prefer using icons rather than bars - which is why I don't want to use NeedToKnow. Since ICDs can't be sourced from in-game without the use of data gathering, users will need to enter the ICD themselves. I'm not sure how adaptable the current code is in terms of creating a time based on a number rather than the duration left on a buff/debuff/cooldown.


> Posted by CurseForge user domzae | Imported from CurseForge issue #86 | Raw

comments.body:
It is definitely something that I have been considering doing, and sooner rather than later now that I have a request for it.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

ICD addon's are a pain at the moment, because they rely on the InternalCooldownLib 1.0 or something, which never gets updated. I always end up putting my own stuff in the .lua to make Heatsink work.

An addon such as TMW which you could manually configure even, just to say... "when i gain this buff, start a 45 second countdown" or alike would be so useful.

Automate it if you can, but that'll be alot of work investigating the ICDs of procs and so on. (which is why the current one is so terrible imo) Something like what I suggest above would be flexible and versatile.
